Text: Term Sheet for Agreement Cc DOC
Term Sheet for Agreementchanges to reflect yours and Traceys comments I have not yet heard from Goldberg DOC DOC

FW SFLP Spreadsheetis a first cut at a spread sheet for the distributions necessary to return at lease to everyone so no partner will have to put up any new money Have you heard from Texaco or BFI Also Marathon committed to the roll over but not the referendum You may need to make a call to Marathon to see if you can convince them on the referendum Conoco also only committed to their proportionate part probably about for the referendum and Don Sanders said he would commit toward the referendum We therefore could have only million from the partners on the referendum if Marathon Texaco and BFI dont contribute We do have however from Reliant Moreover without Sanders BFI and possibly Texaco we may have only around million to rollover into the loan As soon as we can the final answers from all of the partners we will be able to finalize the term sheet with the Sports Authority and get the advance payment on the loan I still havent heard from Goldberg on the term sheet with the Rockets John S Watson Vinson Elkins LLP Fannin First City Tower Houston TX Voice Fax Email PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL Contains attorneyclient communications andor attorney work product Original Message From Telle Michael S Sent Wednesday September PM To Watson John Subject SFLP Spreadsheet Importance High John Take a look at the attached spreadsheet which indicates that we would need a distribution of to have enough for the smaller partners to contribute to the referendum It also shows that we would have left in the partnership to loan to the HCHSA I dont have a printer at home so I have not been able to print this out to check format appearance etc however I may be out of pocket in the morning and wanted you to be able to look at this Mike SFLPxls SFLPxls

got Goldbergs comments this morning on the term sheet with the Rockets there are a number of technical comments which we will make There are about four substantive comments that we are working on and will review with Tracey Ellison Two of the comments relate to you Goldberg wants to limit seats to a maximum of per Partner not total because he said you said at the meeting that each Partner would have a maximum of seats I didnt recall that any such statement by you was meant to limit the seats but was merely an indication of about how many each Partner would have Goldberg admitted the seats was on the sheet handed out at the meeting I cant believe Goldberg is continuing to haggle on this issue I think we should say that the maximum of seats is what the Partners approved and be done with it The other issue is the amount of the referendum funding Goldberg said he understood that the Rockets would match what the Partners would put up Alternatively he wants the right for the Rockets to raise part of their million from others and get credit for it Im not sure whether the Rockets would interfere with you raising your balance of the million In any case I need your input on this issue both for the Rockets term sheet and determining how much we need to get advanced on the loan from the Sports Authority John S Watson Vinson Elkins LLP Fannin First City Tower Houston TX Voice Fax Email PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL Contains attorneyclient communications andor attorney work product
